title: Which software do professional DJ's use? - Quora

response.answer_text: Rekordbox: DJ Software to prepare your music collection for performance.It is made by Pioneer, the same company that makes DJ mixers and CD players for clubs. So it seamlessly connects to all Pioneer’s other DJ hardware.Engine Prime: Denon basically has a similar model with the DJ Software in which you can prepare your music for their CD players and other DJ hardware.Traktor: Traktor is DJ software developed by Native Instruments and also used my many DJ’s.Serato DJ: Is similar to the above two but more used by HipHop DJ’s due to the integration of vinyl accurate scratch possibilities. DAW’s: Digital Audio Workstations: These are programs that let you make music, dj mixes, perform live, mix and master. In contrast to the above DJ software, the DAW’s offer more possibilities in actually making your own music from start to finish. Popular examples of these are: Ableton, Logic, Fruityloops, Reason, Cubase, Pro-Tools, Reaper, Studio One, Bitwig…… Soundcloud and Mixcloud: 2 websites to upload your DJ mixes and tracks to share them with your fans. These two are great platforms to let yourself be heard by new music enthusiasts in any genre.

Traktor Pro 3, Serato DJ, Virtual DJ and Pioneer Recordbox are the most popular DJ softwares in the market. All have its pros and cons. It basically comes down to your personal needs. If you are a beginner with a limited budget, Virtual DJ or Serato Lite might be the choice for you. Traktor Pro is a professional DJ software used by the most popular artists in the music scene such as Richie Hawtin, Carl Cox, Gareth Emery, Nicole Moudaber, Sasha, and many more. This software has filled sound systems and dancefloors across the world, as well as house parties, bars, beaches, and everything in between. The good thing here is that all softwares offer free trial version or a free lite to download, play, experiment, mix and check the best one for you.
